summary: Smartphones and apps have made it easier for people to find work through new online marketplaces, such as ride sharing or meal delivery. But these “platform” or “gig” workers may not understand all of the tax obligations of their new job. For example, companies may classify them as independent contractors instead of employees, and they may not know to make estimated quarterly tax payments. As...
title: Taxpayer Compliance: More Income Reporting Needed for Taxpayers Working through Online Platforms
